viewport.description: The size label for the current screen viewport based on the current screen width

background.description: Background colour of box. Transparent if not specified.

danger.description: Indicates a user action that is destructive and will result in loss of information or cause significant monetary charges. Limit the use of the danger button whenever possible.

inactive.description: Prevents an interactive component from being interacted with and applies accessibility attributes to indicate to the user that this component cannot be used.

inverse.description: Use inverse buttons on darker backgrounds. High and low priority buttons, and danger buttons, are available in inverse.

pressed.description: Applies while an interactive component is being physically pressed. Most visible on touchscreen taps; in React Native Web, this is visible on web mouse clicks only if the pressable is held down.

priority.description: Indicates the importance of the call-to-action. Limit the amount of high priority buttons on a page to prioritize meaningful user flows. Low priority styles are applied by default.

text.description: Text variant visually deprioritize the button styles

viewport.description: The size label for the current screen viewport based on the current screen width

width.description: Available in default, full-width or responsive. Default-width expands based on content. Full-width expands to width of the container. Responsive automatically applies full-width when is displayed on the XS viewport.

rules.description: Buttons should not be disabled or set as inactive. Use inline (on blur) error messaging to provide feedback when the form is invalid. In exceptional instances where disabled buttons are needed, it must be clear to the user why the button is disabled and what they need to do to enable it.

inactive.description: Prevents an interactive component from being interacted with and applies accessibility attributes to indicate to the user that this component cannot be used.

open.description: Applies when a ButtonDropdown is open.

pressed.description: Applies while an interactive component is being physically pressed. Most visible on touchscreen taps; in React Native Web, this is visible on web mouse clicks only if the pressable is held down.

selected.description: Applies while an interactive component is the currently selected one in a set of states or components, for example a button in a `ButtonGroup`.

bold.description: Sets the font weight, to bold on some body text styles. Does not change accessibility properties.

colour.description:
Each typography variant has a default color, and at least a secondary color variant. In exceptional cases where a different colour is needed,
  use the tokens prop.

compact.description: Reduces line height on some body text styles. For data-rich content, not for flow content

inverse.description: Styles the link white for use on dark backgrounds.

size.description:
Styles text as body or heading text with a given size. Smaller numbers indicate larger sizes,
"display" headings are larger than "h" headings. Default is medium size body text. Does not change
accessibility or SEO-related properties; use the heading prop if text should be treated semantically as a heading.

viewport.description: The size label for the current screen viewport based on the current screen width

weight.description: Sets the font weight, default is regular 400 weight. Does not change accessibility properties.

rules.description: The compact line height for the 'default' font size, but doesn't apply for any other styles
Please only bold single words while using with headings
